description.p: Mixxx is a highly customizable, cross-platform DJ application that integrates all the tools DJs need to perform creative live mixes.

ul.li: Blend songs together using automatic BPM matching and remix on the fly with samples, loops and hot cues.
Never miss a beat with the scratchable waveform displays, volume normalization and accurate tempo and key detection.
Spice up your mixes using high quality effects and flexible processing chains.
Keep your music library perfectly organized with crates and playlists.
Take a break by enabling Auto DJ with automatic crossfading.

description.p: Mixxx works with many popular DJ controllers and supports vinyl emulation with Serato, Traktor, and Mixvibes timecodes. Whether you're an experienced turntablist or just getting started, Mixxx has you covered.

description.p: Mixxx 2.5.0 is a major release with tons of new features and important changes under the hood. It includes the following highlights:

ul.li: Mixxx now uses the latest Qt 6 framework, offering improved performance and enhanced compatibility with modern systems
Adjustable beatloop anchor and BPM rate tap & change undo features
New audio effects: compressor and glitch
Support for storing and restoring regular loops when toggling rolling loops
Keyboard shortcuts for playlist management and custom track colors for played and missing tracks
Sidebar actions for playlist shuffle and directory tree refresh
New multi-track property / batch tag editor and enhanced search filters
Support for starting auto DJ on launch and automatically hiding the menubar
Split RGB GLSL waveforms for visualizing slip mode position and waveform beats / time display until next marker
Improved mappings for Denon MC7000, Numark Scratch, Pioneer DDJ-FLX4, NI Traktor Kontrol S4 MK3 and MIDI for light

description.p: Mixxx 2.4.2 is a new minor release with several improvements and bugfixes. The release highlights include:

ul.li: Brand new mappings for Intech Studio TEK2, Numark Scratch and Reloop Mixage MK1, MK2 and Controller Edition
Updated mappings for controllers from Denon, Korg, Novation, Numark, Pioneer, Reloop and Sony
Support for Ubuntu 24.10 (Oracular Oriole)
Improved drag & drop functionality
Better controller engine logging
Various fixes for auto DJ, music library, playlists and history

description.p: Mixxx 2.4.1 is a minor release with numerous bugfixes and small improvements. The release highlights include:

ul.li: Improved mappings for various controllers from Behringer, Denon, Hercules, Nintendo, Pioneer and Native Instruments
Several UI improvements, including animated latching of sync button, enhanced drag & drop support and more polished FX chain controls
Added track count and duration for history playlists
Improved removable drive support on Linux systems
Fixes for library migration between Linux / macOS and Windows

description.p: Mixxx 2.4.0 is a major release with many new features and important changes under the hood. It includes the following highlights:

ul.li: Support for exporting crates, playlists and the library to Engine DJ OS devices.
Added support for saved loops, which can be assigned to any hot cue slot.
Introducing effect chains, a set of effects which can be saved and reloaded with all their parameters and individual meta knob mappings.
Several new features and actions in the track menu.
Support for selecting the sync leader by clicking the new crown symbol button next to the sync button.
Added support for three different key shift algorithms.
The waveform display has been rewritten, solving some longstanding performance issues, especially on macOS.
Native support for macOS ARM systems ("Apple Silicon").
Modernized JavaScript ES7 based controller mapping system and HID backend rework.
